newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-KPN seen buying TNT shares - brokers.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-KPN seen buying TNT shares - brokers.

text.p: Local brokers said Dutch postal and telecoms group Koninklijke PTT Nederland (KPN) had bought 17.54 million shares in takeover target TNT Ltd in early Tuesday trade.

Brokers told Reuters the transaction was handled by County Natwest, which bought a 9.9 percent stake in TNT for the Dutch company on October 2, when KPN announced its agreed A$2.0 billion bid for the transport company.
The latest parcel was acquired at the cash offer price of A$2.45 per share.
The 17.54 million share parcel represents about three percent of TNT's issued capital.
As a foreign-owned company, brokers said KPN can go to 15 percent of TNT, which has 585.55 million shares on issue.
"It seems logical that it is KPN buying as County bought the last tranche for them," said the head of the institutional dealing desk at one of Sydney's largest brokers.

A total of 26.515 million TNT shares were traded on Tuesday with a number of one million parcels moving at A$2.42 and A$2.43 per share. TNT shares were three cents higher at A$2.43 at 10.50 a.m. (0050 GMT). -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
